intro: Aspidopterys canarensis var. glomerata, commonly known as the Canary Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in coastal areas and forested regions.
